title: Using skip and take in a loop
code: library(susographql)  suso_gql_pwcheck(   endpoint = ep,   user = usr,   password = pass,   workspace = "primary" )

title: Using skip and take in a loop
text: Exporting list assignments usually contains 100 rows, single API call allow us get complete list, limit (parameter take) 100. still get assignments, need make use skip parameter. example bellow apply following strategy: single API call, get first 100 assignments, plus parameters totalCount/filteredCount. get total number calculate remaining number assignments server create loop, increase number skip always 100 One problem example bellow column calendarEvent nested data.frame column. simple solution, just delete . can see, total count (using filter, use filteredCount) extracted beginning number rows final data.frame.
code: asslist<-suso_gql_assignments(   endpoint = ep,   user = usr, password = pass, workspace = "primary",   take = 100 )  # tot count (safer to always use filtered count) tot<-asslist$assignments$filteredCount # max lengt is 100 rest<-tot - nrow(asslist$assignments$nodes) # number of loops n_loops<-ceiling(rest/100) # skip/take augment ass_loop<-function(i) {   asslist<-suso_gql_assignments(     endpoint = ep,     user = usr, password = pass, workspace = "primary",     skip = 100*i, take = 100   )   # remove calenderevent otherwise rbind gets difficult   dout<-asslist$assignments$nodes   dout$calendarEvent<-NULL   return(dout)  } # lapply for the loop asslist_rest<-lapply(1:n_loops, ass_loop) # bind the last two lists asslist_rest <- do.call(rbind, c(asslist_rest, make.row.names = FALSE))  # bind the first df and the result of the rest into 1 (remove cal event first) asslist<-asslist$assignments$nodes asslist$calendarEvent<-NULL asslist<-rbind(asslist, asslist_rest)  # Compare the final number of rows with the total tot==nrow(asslist)  # Column names names(asslist)

title: Using skip and take in a loop
text: , however now keep nested data.frame column. result , however calendarEvent nested data.frame columns now included. Though using calendar events survey, column relevant , first solutions sufficient.
code: # 1. get first list (limit is automatic 100 but we use the parameter here for demonstration) asslist<-suso_gql_assignments(   endpoint = ep,   user = usr, password = pass, workspace = "primary",   take = 100 )  # tot count (safer to always use filtered count) tot<-asslist$assignments$filteredCount # max lengt is 100 rest<-tot - nrow(asslist$assignments$nodes) # number of loops n_loops<-ceiling(rest/100) # skip/take augment ass_loop<-function(i) {   asslist<-suso_gql_assignments(     endpoint = ep,     user = usr, password = pass, workspace = "primary",     skip = 100*i, take = 100   )   # remove calenderevent otherwise rbind gets difficult   dout<-asslist$assignments$nodes   #dout$calendarEvent<-NULL   return(dout)  }  # lapply for the loop asslist_rest<-lapply(1:n_loops, ass_loop)  # Function for rbind with nested data.frames row_bind_list <- function(df_list) {   # Check if all data frames in the list have the same structure   if (!all(sapply(df_list, function(x) all(names(x) == names(df_list[[1]]))))) {     stop("All data frames in the list must have the same columns.")   }    # Bind regular columns and nested data.frame columns separately   regular_cols <- which(!sapply(df_list[[1]], is.data.frame))   nested_cols <- which(sapply(df_list[[1]], is.data.frame))    # Bind regular columns   regular_df <- do.call(rbind, lapply(df_list, function(df) df[, regular_cols, drop = FALSE]))    # Bind nested data.frame columns   nested_dfs <- lapply(nested_cols, function(ncol) {     do.call(rbind, lapply(df_list, function(df) df[[ncol]]))   })    # Combine regular and nested columns into one data frame   bound_df <- cbind(regular_df, setNames(nested_dfs, names(df_list[[1]])[nested_cols]))    return(bound_df) }  # Add the first 100 & bind the data.frames asslist_rest[[(n_loops+1)]]<-asslist$assignments$nodes asslist<-row_bind_list(asslist_rest)  # Compare the final number of rows with the total tot==nrow(asslist)  # Column names names(asslist)

title: Authors and Citation
text: Michael Wild. Maintainer, author, copyright holder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Wild M (2024). susographql: Comprehensive Interface Survey Solutions GraphQL API. R package version 0.1.4, https://michael-cw.github.io/susographql/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {susographql: Comprehensive Interface to the Survey Solutions GraphQL API},   author = {Michael Wild},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.4},   url = {https://michael-cw.github.io/susographql/}, }

what: Comprehensive Interface to the Survey Solutions GraphQL API
title: Comprehensive Interface to the Survey Solutions GraphQL API
text: susographql R package offers comprehensive interface World Bank’s Survey Solutions Computer Assisted Survey System (CASS) via GraphQL API. package supports current queries mutations, seamlessly integrating latest advancements like map uploads. harnesses power modern httr2 package, ensuring streamlined efficient user experience without need external GraphQL client packages. Beyond basic API interactions, susographql brings assortment helper functions. thoughtfully designed simplify use query filters, elevating user experience broadening data manipulation retrieval capabilities. Dive details available Survey Solutions GraphQL queries mutations comprehensive API documentation. susographql crafted “bare-bone” API client, delivering data largely original server format, offers users unmatched flexibility designing , complex processes fully customized needs. approach also means minimal data manipulation background, catering users prefer hands-approach data handling. seek deterministic experience built-data transformations ready--use data structures including support integration R Shiny application, recommend SurveySolutionsAPI (httr version) newer SurveySolutionsAPIv2 (httr2 version), cover , Survey Solutions REST API GraphQL API handled package1.

title: Comprehensive Interface to the Survey Solutions GraphQL API
text: Install R: https://cran.r-project.org/mirrors.html (version 4.1.1 greater) Install R Studio: https://rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/ (version 1.2.5001-3 newer) Make sure devtools package installed, install : install actual package:
code: install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("michael-cw/susographql")

title: Comprehensive Interface to the Survey Solutions GraphQL API
text: Set personal Survey Solutions Server request free Personal Demo Server (PDS) (testing !!). Set API user credentials. Use credentials connect server. Contrary bigger sisters, SurveySolutionsAPI (httr version) SurveySolutionsAPIv2 (httr2 version) package come lot helpers credential handling setting, nevertheless light-weight credentials check included: returns either 200 credentials correct 400 otherwise. Also note, endpoint requires full path including graphql part end.
code: library(susographql)  suso_gql_pwcheck(   endpoint = "https://demo.mysurvey.solutions/graphql",   user = "someuser",   password = "andhispassword",   workspace = "primary" )

title: Comprehensive Interface to the Survey Solutions GraphQL API
text: can either use standard GitHub approach filing bug report/feature request use Survey Solutions user forum . Please continue check updates, constantly working improve package well integrating new GraphQL queries mutations soon available Survey Solutions.

what: Add a calendar event to an Assignment — suso_gql_addassignmentcalendarevent
title: Add a calendar event to an Assignment — suso_gql_addassignmentcalendarevent
text: Add calendar event assignment

title: Add a calendar event to an Assignment — suso_gql_addassignmentcalendarevent
code: suso_gql_addassignmentcalendarevent(   endpoint = NULL,   workspace = NULL,   user = NULL,   password = NULL,   token = NULL,   assignmentId = NULL,   comment = NULL,   newStart = NULL,   startTimezone = "UTC" )

title: Add a calendar event to an Assignment — suso_gql_addassignmentcalendarevent
text: endpoint GraphQL endpoint server workspace Server Workspace, NULL uses default user API username password API user password token Survey Solutions server token provided apiUser apiPass ignored assignmentId assignment id comment comment string newStart new start date, format must : 2024-01-16 01:41:14 startTimezone time zone tablet device, use OlsonNames

title: Add a calendar event to an Assignment — suso_gql_addassignmentcalendarevent
text: successfull, returns list executed mutation

title: Add a calendar event to an Assignment — suso_gql_addassignmentcalendarevent
code: if (FALSE) { # suso_gql_pwcheck() == 200 ## Requires Survey Solutions Server and API credentials  # Create a calendar event for assignment 208 on 2024-01-16 01:41:14, # in timezone Chile/Continental  suso_gql_addassignmentcalendarevent(endpoint = ep, user = usr, password = pass, workspace = ws, assignmentId = 208, newStart = "2024-01-16 01:41:14", startTimezone = "Chile/Continental", comment = "Lets Go!") }

text: endpoint GraphQL endpoint server workspace Server Workspace, NULL uses default user API username password API user password token Survey Solutions server token provided apiUser apiPass ignored interviewId interviewId comment comment string newStart new start date, format must : 2024-01-16 01:41:14 startTimezone time zone tablet device, use OlsonNames

text: successfull, returns list executed mutation

title: Add a calendar event to an Interview — suso_gql_addinterviewcalendarevent
code: if (FALSE) { # suso_gql_pwcheck() == 200 ## Requires Survey Solutions Server and API credentials  # Create a calendar event for a selected interview on 2024-01-16 01:41:14, # in timezone UTC  suso_gql_addinterviewcalendarevent(endpoint = ep, user = usr, password = pass, workspace = ws, interviewId = "bac4d15253b541dd86a003dc7f854e35", newStart = "2024-01-16 01:41:14", startTimezone = "UTC", comment = "Lets Go!") }

text: endpoint GraphQL endpoint server workspace Server Workspace, NULL uses default user API username password API user password token Survey Solutions server token provided apiUser apiPass ignored fileName name map file server userName name interviewer map assigned

title: Assigns a map to a user — suso_gql_addusertomap
text: successfull, returns list executed mutation

title: Assigns a map to a user — suso_gql_addusertomap
code: if (FALSE) { # suso_gql_pwcheck() == 200 ## Requires Survey Solutions Server and API credentials  # Assign map seg_168_ALL.tif to user int0073  suso_gql_addusertomap(endpoint = ep, user = usr, password = pass, workspace = ws, fileName = "seg_168_ALL.tif", userName = "int0073")  }

title: Get all assignments — suso_gql_assignments
text: Allows user retrieve filtered unfiltered assignment data.

title: Get all assignments — suso_gql_assignments
code: suso_gql_assignments(   endpoint = NULL,   workspace = NULL,   user = NULL,   password = NULL,   token = NULL,   archived = FALSE,   id = NULL,   questionnaireId = NULL,   version = NULL,   responsibleId = NULL,   webMode = FALSE,   take = NULL,   skip = NULL )

title: Get all assignments — suso_gql_assignments
text: endpoint GraphQL endpoint server workspace Server Workspace, NULL uses default user API username password API password token Survey Solutions server token provided apiUser apiPass ignored archived Boolean assignment archived id Assignment ID questionnaireId Questionnaire ID version Questionnaire version responsibleId ID person currently responsible assignment webMode Boolean webmode take take specified integer numeber assignments skip skip first integer number assignments

title: Get all assignments — suso_gql_assignments
text: successfull, returns list (filtered) responses

title: Get all assignments — suso_gql_assignments
code: if (FALSE) { # suso_gql_pwcheck() == 200 ## Requires Survey Solutions Server and API credentials  # Get all assignments without filter  suso_gql_assignments(endpoint = ep, user = usr, password = pass, workspace = ws)  # Select assignment with id 25 suso_gql_assignments(endpoint = ep, user = usr, password = pass, workspace = ws, id = 25)  # Select assignment excluding id 25, by using susoop_numeric suso_gql_assignments(endpoint = ep, user = usr, password = pass, workspace = ws, id = susoop_num$neq(25))  }

code: suso_gql_interviews(   endpoint = NULL,   workspace = NULL,   user = NULL,   password = NULL,   token = NULL,   assignmentId = NULL,   clientKey = NULL,   createdDate = NULL,   errorsCount = NULL,   identifyingData = NULL,   interviewMode = NULL,   notAnsweredCount = NULL,   questionnaireId = NULL,   questionnaireVersion = NULL,   questionnaireVariable = NULL,   responsibleName = NULL,   responsibleRole = NULL,   status = NULL,   supervisorName = NULL,   sortby_updateDateUtc = NULL,   sortby_notAnsweredCount = NULL,   sortby_createdDate = NULL,   sortby_errorsCount = NULL,   sortby_assignmentId = NULL,   sortby_status = NULL,   sortby_receivedByInterviewerAtUtc = NULL,   sortby_responsibleName = NULL,   take = NULL,   skip = NULL )

title: Get all interviews — suso_gql_interviews
text: endpoint GraphQL endpoint server workspace Server Workspace, NULL uses default user API username password API password token Survey Solutions server token provided apiUser apiPass ignored assignmentId Assignment ID clientKey Interview key createdDate Creation data interview errorsCount number errors identifyingData Pre-loaded identifying data interviewMode Interview mode (CAWI CAPI) notAnsweredCount number unanswered questions questionnaireId questionnnaire id questionnaireVersion questionnaire version questionnaireVariable variable questionnaire responsibleName Name person responsible responsibleRole Role person responsible status interview supervisorName Name supervisor responsible user sortby_updateDateUtc sort updated UTC time, either ASC ascending DESC descending sortby_notAnsweredCount sort errors count, either ASC ascending DESC descending sortby_createdDate sort creation date, either ASC ascending DESC descending sortby_errorsCount sort number errors, either ASC ascending DESC descending sortby_assignmentId sort assignmentId, either ASC ascending DESC descending sortby_status sort interview status, either ASC ascending DESC descending sortby_receivedByInterviewerAtUtc sort date table received interview, either ASC ascending DESC descending sortby_responsibleName sort current responsible user, either ASC ascending DESC descending take take specified integer numeber interviews skip skip first integer number interviews

title: Get all interviews — suso_gql_interviews
text: successfull, returns list (filtered) responses

title: Get all interviews — suso_gql_interviews
code: if (FALSE) { # suso_gql_pwcheck() == 200 ## Requires Survey Solutions Server and API credentials  # Get all interviews without filter suso_gql_interviews(endpoint = ep, user = usr, password = pass, workspace = "primary")  # Select interviews which are not completed yet suso_gql_interviews(endpoint = ep, user = usr, password = pass, workspace = "primary", status = susoop_str$neq("COMPLETED"))  # Select interviews which have 3 or more errors suso_gql_assignments(endpoint = ep, user = usr, password = pass, workspace = "primary", errorsCount = susoop_num$gte(3))  # Select interviews which have less than 3 errors suso_gql_assignments(endpoint = ep, user = usr, password = pass, workspace = "primary", errorsCount = susoop_num$ngt(3))     }

code: suso_gql_questionnaireitems(   endpoint = NULL,   workspace = NULL,   user = NULL,   password = NULL,   token = NULL,   id = NULL,   version = NULL,   variable = NULL,   scope = NULL,   identifying = NULL,   title = NULL,   includedInReportingAtUtc = NULL )

title: Get all Questions in a Questionnaires — suso_gql_questionnaireitems
text: endpoint GraphQL endpoint server workspace Server Workspace, NULL uses default user API username password API password token Survey Solutions server token provided apiUser apiPass ignored id Questionnaire ID version Questionnaire version variable Get questions specific variable scope Get questions specific scope identifying TRUE identifying questions exported title text questions includedInReportingAtUtc time last reporting

title: Get all Questions in a Questionnaires — suso_gql_questionnaireitems
text: successfull, returns list (filtered) responses

title: Get all Questions in a Questionnaires — suso_gql_questionnaireitems
code: if (FALSE) { # suso_gql_pwcheck() == 200 ## Requires Survey Solutions Server and API credentials  questlist<-suso_gql_questionnaires(     endpoint = ep, user = usr,     password = pass,     workspace = "primary")  id<-questlist$questionnaires$nodes$questionnaireId[1] v<-questlist$questionnaires$nodes$version[1]  # Get all questions from a questionnaire/version without filter  suso_gql_questionnaireitems(endpoint = ep, user = usr,      password = pass,      workspace = ws,      id = id,      version = v)  # Select only identifying questions suso_gql_questionnaireitems(endpoint = ep, user = usr,      password = pass,      workspace = ws,      id = id,      version = v,      identifying = TRUE)  # Select only questions which have not interviewer scope suso_gql_questionnaireitems(endpoint = ep, user = usr,       password = pass,       workspace = ws,       id = id,       version = v,       scope = susoop_str$neq("INTERVIEWER")) }

title: Upload map to server — suso_gql_uploadmap
text: endpoint GraphQL endpoint server. workspace Server Workspace, NULL uses default. user API username. token Survey Solutions server token provided apiUser apiPass ignored. password API password. path_to_zip path single zip file path directory zip files usePar=TRUE. usePar TRUE requests performed parallel EXPERIMENTAL! n_par number parallel requests, required usePar = TRUE EXPERIMENTAL!

title: Upload map to server — suso_gql_uploadmap
text: list details successfully processed maps, usePar = TRUE, node element list data.table successfully processed uploads.

title: Upload map to server — suso_gql_uploadmap
text: usePar = TRUE path directory needs provided containing zipped map files. feature may useful uploading large number maps, however careful, number parallel requests size zip file, may overload server. Initial testing gradually increasing n_par parameter therefore strongly recommended.

title: Upload map to server — suso_gql_uploadmap
code: if (FALSE) { # suso_gql_pwcheck() == 200 ## Requires Survey Solutions Server and API credentials  # Upload a single zip file containing maps  suso_gql_uploadmap(endpoint = ep, user = usr, password = pass, workspace = ws, path_to_zip = "./dev/shapes_for_test.zip", usePar = FALSE)  # Upload a directory with zip files containing maps  suso_gql_uploadmap(endpoint = ep, user = usr, password = pass, workspace = ws, path_to_zip = "./dev/allzipforupload/", usePar = TRUE) }

what: Utility Functions for numeric operator selection — transformers.numeric
title: Utility Functions for numeric operator selection — transformers.numeric
text: Can used filters ("") operator selection. none selected, operator always defaults `eq()`. functions bellow valid corresponding inputs ComparableInt64OperationFilterInput ComparableNullableOfInt32OperationFilterInput.

title: Utility Functions for numeric operator selection — transformers.numeric
code: eq(value_set)  neq(value_set)  inbetw(value_set)  ninbetw(value_set)  gt(value_set)  ngt(value_set)  gte(value_set)  ngte(value_set)  lt(value_set)  nlt(value_set)  lte(value_set)  nlte(value_set)

title: Utility Functions for numeric operator selection — transformers.numeric
text: value_set parameter set operator

title: Utility Functions for numeric operator selection — transformers.numeric
text: list single named element (operator name) handed filter.

title: Utility Functions for numeric operator selection — transformers.numeric
text: Also see susoop_num selector list, allows , just select function named list.

title: Utility Functions for numeric operator selection — transformers.numeric
text: eq(): equal neq(): equal inbetw(): inbetween (requires numeric vector upper lower bound, .e. c(1, 5)) ninbetw(): inbetween (requires numeric vector upper lower bound, .e. c(1,5)) gt(): greater ngt(): greater gte(): greater equal ngte(): greater equal lt(): lower nlt(): lower lte(): lower equal nlte(): lower equal

title: Utility Functions for numeric operator selection — transformers.numeric
code: # set filter equal to 0 eq(0) #> $eq #> [1] 0 #>   # set filter to a value from 0 to 5 inbetw(c(0, 5)) #> $`in` #> [1] 0 5 #>

code: contains(value_set)  endsWith(value_set)  ncontains(value_set)  nendsWith(value_set)  nstartsWith(value_set)  startsWith(value_set)  inclu(value_set)  ninclu(value_set)

title: Utility Functions for string operator selection — transformers.string
text: contains(): contains endsWith(): ends ncontains(): contains nendsWith(): ends nstartsWith(): starts startsWith(): starts inclu(): ninclu():

title: Utility Functions for string operator selection — transformers.string
code: # set filter so that the string contains "area" contains("area") #> $contains #> [1] "area" #>   # set filter to string ending with .shp endsWith(".shp") #> $endsWith #> [1] ".shp" #>

title: susographql 0.1.4
text: stable release

title: susographql 0.1.3
text: added support parallel upload maps added helpers (susoop_num, susoop_str) filter operator selection added retry transient http errors (500)

title: susographql 0.1.2
text: complete transition httr2 package added helper functions request creation & processing

title: susographql 0.1.1
text: new sorting options new filter options added map upload

title: susographql 0.1.0
text: beta release package.
